definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
Don't spread abroad the shame of the family, don't believe rumors lightly. (idiom)/Don't wash your dirty linen in public, don't listen to others' gossip.
pinyin: jia1 chou3 bu4 ke3 wai4 chuan2 , liu2 yan2 qie4 mo4 qing1 xin4
containing_words.word: 家丑不可外传，流言切莫轻信

sentences.english: Love really need courage to face the tattle and prate.
sentences.chinese: 爱真的需要勇气，来面对流言蜚语。

sentences.english: Rumours are rumours. It will soon blow over.
sentences.chinese: 流言终归是流言，不久就会平息。

sentences.english: Rumours are rumours. It will soon blow over.
sentences.chinese: 流言终归是流言，不久就会平息。

sentences.english: In the spring of 1946, rumors of Dai Li’s retirement were rife.
sentences.chinese: 1946年春，戴笠即将退休的流言盛流。

sentences.english: He doesn't care about scandals, slanders, calumnies, aspersions, or defamation.
sentences.chinese: 他不在乎流言蜚语，诽谤，中伤。

sentences.english: Even just passing gossip and hearsay can prime your mind for illness with potent effect.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕只传传流言蜚语和道听途说都能灌输强烈影响。

sentences.english: She broadcast the gossip all over the town.
sentences.chinese: 她将这个流言传遍全镇。

sentences.english: Avoid the drama and gossip and keep your salary to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 避免流言的最好方法就是绝口不提。

sentences.english: No angry to gossip is our cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 对待流言不怒是我们的大勇和修养。

sentences.english: But for weeks, rumors of turmoil and mass resignations at Caijing have circulated online.
sentences.chinese: 但几周来，混乱及大规模辞职的流言已在网上流传。

sentences.english: But there is more to me than just a tabloid girl.
sentences.chinese: 但是总有一些很过分的流言蜚语加诸在我身上。

sentences.english: The circulation of gossip is vicious.
sentences.chinese: 传播流言蜚语是可恶的。

sentences.english: THE GIST Gossiping can be beneficial.
Disordered nerves and bad digestion are a common cause of backbiting.
sentences.chinese: 神经过敏和承担力差是生成流言蜚语的常见原因。

sentences.english: He discredited my good name with gossip.
sentences.chinese: 他用流言蜚语败坏我的好名声。

definition: rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
